page.title: 09Dundon Hill camp.
page.content: A small and wooded knoll rises up out of the small village of Compton Dundon. At the top of a narrow untrodden path, is a large clearing with many paths leading into it. Many centuries ago this clearing was full of life. An enormous Iron_Age fort stood there about 800 years ago. Surrounding the large plateau which lies some 250 feet above the countryside is a seven foot ditch. At the other end of the knoll lies a 12 foot high 'beacon' from which most of the surrounding countryside can be seen. Unfortunately most of the archaeological remains of this fort are enveloped in undergrowth. Another defence of this fort was that it had a stone wall some 7 feet high, that encompassed the whole of the top of the hill. As most other forts in this area,Dundon has gone to wrack and ruin
